Assignment2’s documentation!¶

This is the documentation of the assignment2 package!

FiniteStateMachine¶

Module Name:
fsm_node.py
Synopsis:
This module defines a ROS node that simulates a robot moving through various rooms and corridors. The robot has a battery which can run low, in which case it needs to charge. The robot can also reach urgent rooms and visit them.
Author:
Giovanni Di Marco <giovannidimarco06@gmail.com>
Date:
15th July, 2023

Defines the state where the robot charges its battery.

scripts.fsm.main()[source]¶

Initializes the ROS node, creates a state machine for the robot, and starts an introspection server to visualize the state machine.

scripts.fsm.move_to_position_client(client, x, skip)[source]¶

Calls a service to move the robot to a given position.

Parameters:
  • client (rospy.ServiceProxy) – The ROS service client.
  • x (float) – The target position.
  • skip (bool) – Determines whether to skip the movement or not.
Returns:

The response from the service call.
Return type:

PlanningSrvResponse

Rotates the robot to a given position.

Parameters:
  • position (float) – The target position for the robot.
  • has_to_wait (bool) – Determines whether the robot has to wait after reaching the target position.

Battery state¶

Module Name:
batterystatus.py
Synopsis:
This module provides a ROS node for managing the battery status of a robot. It checks the battery level at regular intervals and performs appropriate actions based on the current battery state.
Author:
Giovanni Di Marco <giovannidimarco06@gmail.com>
Date:
15th July, 2023

This is a ROS node for managing the battery status of a robot. It keeps track of the battery level and controls the behaviour of the robot according to the battery state. When the battery is running too low or is empty, it commands the robot to cancel its current tasks and head to the charging station.

scripts.BatteryState.BatteryState()[source]¶

Manages the state of the battery.

This function keeps track of the battery level. If the battery is running low or is empty, the robot will cancel its current tasks and go to the charging station. If the battery is currently charging, it will monitor until it’s fully charged. Status of the battery is pubblished throught the topic BatteryState

Parameters:None –
Returns:None

  • des_y (float) – The desired y coordinate.

Does the movements of the robot to the desired room and updates certain parameters when the robot moves.

Parameters:goal (MoveBaseGoal) – The goal containing the name of the desired room.
Returns:A response indicating if the action was successful or not.

Date:
15th July, 2023

Calls the ArUco marker detection service and request room information for the detected markers.

Parameters:armcli (ArmorClient) – An ArmorClient instance to interact with the knowledge base.
Returns:A list of elements associated with the rooms.
Return type:list
scripts.ontology.main()[source]¶

The main function to initialize the ROS node and the service.

This function initiates a ROS node named ‘InitMapNode’, then it creates a service named ‘initmap_service’ that uses the ‘Empty’ service type and is handled by ‘service_callback’ function.

scripts.ontology.request_room_info(marker_ids, armcli)[source]¶

Requests room information for a given list of marker IDs.

Parameters:
  • marker_ids (list) – A list of marker IDs for which to request room information.
  • armcli (ArmorClient) – An ArmorClient instance to interact with the knowledge base.
Returns:

A list of elements associated with the rooms.
Return type:

list
scripts.ontology.service_callback(request)[source]¶

Callback for the initmap_service. It initializes the map of the environment.

Parameters:request (Empty) – The request of the service call.
Returns:An empty list.
Return type:list

Aruco detection¶

Module Name:
aruco_detection_service.py
Synopsis:
This module defines a ROS service for detecting ArUco markers and returning a list of the IDs of the detected markers.
Author:
Giovanni Di Marco <giovannidimarco06@gmail.com>
Date:
15th July, 2023
scripts.acquiring_aruco.callback(data)[source]¶

Callback for the /aruco_marker_publisher/detected_ids topic.

Args: data: The message data.

scripts.acquiring_aruco.handle_aruco_detection(req)[source]¶

Handler for the aruco_detection service. It rotates the robot’s arm and returns a list of the IDs of the detected ArUco markers.

Args: req: The service request.

Returns: An ArucoDetectionResponse with a list of the IDs of the detected markers.

scripts.acquiring_aruco.main()[source]¶

Initializes the ROS node, subscriber, and service for detecting ArUco markers. Spins the node to keep the service responsive.

The node is named ‘aruco_id_service’ and the service is ‘aruco_detection’. The node subscribes to the ‘/aruco_marker_publisher/detected_ids’ topic.

When a message is received on the topic, the callback function is invoked to update the detected_ids set with the ID from the message.

When the service is called, it invokes the handle_aruco_detection function to rotate the robot’s arm, detect ArUco markers, and return a list of the IDs of the detected markers.

scripts.acquiring_aruco.rotating(position)[source]¶

Rotates the first joint of the group to a specified position.

Args: position: The position in radians to rotate the joint to.
